title: Antigonish Movement
details: Important adult education and self-help movement, begun in 1928

title: Arrival of Foreign Protestants in Nova Scotia (1749-1756)
details: Earliest German-speaking emigrant group to form stable, lasting communities in what is now Canada

title: Attack at Grand-Pr�
details: French and Indian capture of Grand-Pr� in 1747

title: Bank Fishery
details: Commemorates offshore fisheries of Atlantic Provinces

title: Battle of the Atlantic
details: Royal Canadian Navy, the Merchant Marine and the Royal Canadian Air Force were all essential to keeping open the supply lines to Britain during World War II

title: Beginnings of Coal Mining
details: Mining established in 1720 to supply Louisbourg

title: Black Loyalist Experience
details: Commemorates Black Loyalists in Nova Scotia and New Brunswick

title: Bluenose
details: Famous Canadian schooner, has become national symbol

title: Building of the Canso Causeway
details: United Cape Breton physically, economically, and symbolically to the rest of Canada

title: Cabot's Landfall in the New World
details: Landing on June 24, 1497, beginning of British Empire overseas

title: Cape Breton - Newfoundland Cable
details: Vital section of first transatlantic cable completed in 1856

title: Coming of the New England Planters (Pre-Loyalists)
details: Settlers in undeveloped areas and lands of displaced Acadians, 1760-63

title: Construction of the Sambro Island Lighthouse
details: Earliest lighthouse in Canada, 1758

title: Dalhousie Law School
details: First school of common law in the British Empire, 1883

title: Entry of Women in the Military in World War II
details: Women's service within the Canadian Navy in World War II

title: Establishment of the Experimental Farm Branch
details: 5 experimental farms established by the federal government, 1886

title: Establishment of the Halifax Zoological Garden
details: First zoo in America north of Mexico, established by Andrew Downs, 1847

title: Expulsion of the Acadians
details: Acadians deported in 1755-62 by British decree

title: First Aeroplane Flying in Canada
details: Flight of the Silver Dart in 1909, first in Canada

title: First Canadian House of Assembly
details: 1758 meeting was important step in development of democratic government

title: First Printing Press in North America
details: First newspaper in British North America, begun in 1752

title: First Responsible Government in the British Empire Overseas
details: First Executive Council of majority party elected representatives (1848)

title: Formation and development of the Canadian Home and School Federation
details: Made an outstanding contribution to childhood well-being

title: Founding of the Canadian Naval Service
details: Founded in 1910, was the first national service of its kind; played a key role in the Dominion's contributions to the Allied effort during the First World War

title: General Mining Association
details: Major coal producer in British North America, 1827-65

title: Halifax and Castine
details: British expedition from Halifax invades Castine, Maine, British occupy eastern Maine until conclusion of War of 1812, 1814-15

title: Iroquois at Annapolis Royal
details: Members of the Five Nations Iroquois Confederacy with the British in the defence of Annapolis Royal against the French and their aboriginal allies, 1712-1713

title: Isgonish-French River Portage
details: Important route from Gulf of St. Lawrence to Atlantic Coast

title: Liverpool Privateers
details: Protected Nova Scotia coast, fought French, Spanish and American ships

title: Loyalists at Shelburne
details: Town founded by Loyalist refugees in 1783

title: Naval Encounter
details: British attack on French fleet headed for Louisbourg, 1745

title: N� 2 Construction Battalion, C. E. F.
details: Contribution of Blacks to Canadian effort World War I

title: Pony Express
details: Used to carry news dispatches from Halifax to Digby in 1849

title: Post War Immigration
details: Following World War II, reception facilities at Pier 21 in Halifax received about 1.5 million immigrants from Europe

title: Postal Service in Nova Scotia
details: Monthly packet ship service between Halifax and New York begun in 1755

title: Poutrincourt's Mill
details: 1607 flour mill, first water-powered flour mill north of Mexico

title: Role of the Canadian Merchant Navy during the Second World War
details: Contributed to the final outcome of World War II by transporting materiel and military personnel throughout the world

title: Sack of Lunenburg
details: American privateers looted the town in 1782

title: Shannon and Chesapeake (vessels)
details: War of 1812, capture of USS Chesapeake in 1813 an important British victory near Boston

title: Shipbuilding in Nova Scotia
details: This industry grew as settlement did in the 18th-century

title: Sisters of Charity of Saint Vincent de Paul, Halifax
details: Established a wide variety of educational, health care and social services missions

title: St. Laurent Class of Canadian Warship
details: First major vessels to be completely Canadian in concept and design

title: Starr Manufacturing Company
details: One of the pre-eminent ice skate manufacturers in the world

title: Transatlantic Wireless
details: First west to east transatlantic message, to England in 1902

title: W. D. Lawrence (Vessel)
details: Canada's largest square-rigger, 2459 tons, built 1872-74

title: War Brides
details: Contributions of the some 48,000 war brides who came to Canada as a direct result of Canadian participation in World War II

title: Windsor Agricultural Fair
details: Begun in 1765, featured livestock, produce and sports events
